3: This should be the target of our mission, the ground tactical terminal.
Well, judging by the appearance, the tactical terminal is not damaged. Seems that the Ascendants haven't found it yet.
Let's test and recycle the data, Lee.
First, we need to activate the tactical terminal. By the way, I've discovered something.
On the way here, I've explored the information about the memory data many times. Since the records were too far back, there's a severe loss of data.
From the analysis of limited records, the memory data is not dangerous. But there's something wrong about the records...
Hmm... Such a good sleep... Well?
I feel so light! Where are our bodies?
Protect the Commandant!
Commandant? There's no moe reaction. Such a familiar feeling... yet a bit different. Are you loser? Have you betrayed the Moe Army?
So I guess this is what the missing data and abnormal reaction in the records refer to.
The original memory data actually exists in such a form... That's incredible.
Miss Cottie... seems to have mistaken you with someone she knows.
I sort of figured it out. Commandant, if you don't mind, please allow me to explain to Marshal Cottie what's going on.
Wh-what? Does it mean we won't be able to have donuts again?
I kind of... feel sorry for her.
Data shows that the memory prototype of Cottie died from complications of hyperglycemia caused by eating too many donuts at the age of 86.
How? The donut entered the other stomach, why did it turn into my blood sugar?
Doesn't the other stomach also grow in you?
Any way, since the Moe War is over, I have no reason to fight any more...
Do you think I'd say that? Lo... Commandant over there!
In a word, you have to win my approval if you want me to help you!
I don't care about that so-called Punishing Virus. It's unforgivable for it to go after me, the great marshal!
Restore everything about the Moe Army back to normal, the memory, the data... save it all to win my approval, got it?
Hmph, that's glad to hear.
Memory data integrity test passed. No sign of Punishing Virus corruption was detected. Carrying out memory recycle as planned.
I'll allow you to take me away for now to test the results of your mission!
Yes, Commandant.
—Memory: Cottie, recycled.
